hanzi-su-wiki:
標

Значения

Знак, указатель; вывеска

Мнемоника

Кусок дерева 木 с вырезанными знаками 票.

Варианты

标
purpleculture_pinyin:
biāo
mark; sign; label; to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc; to bear (a brand name, registration number etc); prize; award; bid; target; quota; (old) the topmost branches of a tree; visible symptom; classifier for military units
отметка; знак; метка; обозначить символом, этикеткой, надписью и т. д .; носить (фирменное наименование, регистрационный номер и т. д.); приз; награда; делать ставку; цель; квота; (старые) самые верхние ветви дерева; видимый симптом; классификатор воинских частей
rtega_mnemonic:
標標RS
标标		a mark, symbol, label, sign, standard
  • mark a ballot 票 before it goes in the wooden 木 box while counting the votes/wooden 木 object on the altar 示: a symbol of religion

(Simplified: 标)
Antonyms: 本
Pictophonetic: 票 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.

heisig_chinese_memo: Trees were frequenly used as markers in those days, indicating where one had to go to cast their ballots/tickets.
heisig_constituent: signpost, tree, wood, ballot, old west, altar, show, two, small
Keyword_KANJIDIC: signpost, seal, mark, stamp, imprint, symbol, emblem, trademark, evidence, souvenir, target
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: Указатель, печать, знак, печать, печать, символ, эмблема, товарный знак, свидетельство, сувениры, целевые
koohiiStory1: Trees were frequenly used as signposts in those days, indicating where one had to go to cast their ballots.
koohiiStory2: Large wooden signposts are planted on peoples lawns, with the faces of their representatives all saying: "Vote [1] Me!" for the upcoming ballot.
jp_example_words:
座標(ざひょう): coordinate(s)
標語(ひょうご): motto, slogan, catchword
標識(ひょうしき): sign, mark
標準(ひょうじゅん): standard, level
標本(ひょうほん): example, specimen
目標(もくひょう): mark, objective, target
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You see a tree with a helicopter and a jackhammer tied to it. You look closer, because this is an odd sight, and realize that there is a sign here too. It's telling you to beware of helicopters and jackhammers in this woods. It's a poorly made signpost!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: This is not the best signpost you've ever seen, but it's better than nothing at all, you suppose.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you look at this weird signpost you notice a button. You press it because it will supposedly tell you more about these dangerous helicopters and jackhammers. Instead, it just yells out in a loud obnoxious voice: HEYO (ひょう)!!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Press it a few more times and hear the sound in your head. Also spell it out in kana as you hear it as a nice little additional visual.
Ru_Meaning: signpost, seal, mark, stamp, imprint, symbol, emblem, trademark, evidence, souvenir, target

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Their is a mark on the tree pointing in the direction of the nearest altar.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " wood ", " ticket " sound. The original meaning is treetop. "Said Wen": "Biao, Mu Xiaomo also. Cong Mu, the sound of votes." "Zhuangzi. "Heaven and Earth": "Upward is like a standard branch, and people are like a wild deer." Lu Deming explained: "The branch of the tree at the end of the word is not on the upper side." "Book of Later Han. "The Biography of Ma Rong" "Liu Biao Duan", Li Xian's note: "Liu, Biao, and Mu Mo Ye."

The extension of " mark " indicates the top. "Jade articles. "Headquarters": "Biao, Dian Ye." Such as "Chu Ci. Chapter Nine. "Sorrowful Return to the Wind": "The cliffs on the high rocks are on the cliffs, and the mark of the females is upside down." Li Bai of the Tang Dynasty "The Road to Shu is Difficult": "There are six dragons on the top of the sky, and the bottom is the rushing back to Sichuan "High mark" means the tip of a mountain.

" Standard " also said minor or the surface of things, and " this " relative. Such as "Huainanzi. "Astronomy": "The species move, the specimen corresponds." "Su Wen. "Specimen and Disease Biography": "The disease is more than the original, the root is the root, and the root is treated first, and then the root is cured.” Later, the term "treatment of the symptoms but not the root of the problem" is used to describe only the minor aspects of the problem, but not the root of the problem.

" Mark " also means a mark or mark. Xu Kai, "The Biography of the Department of Literature. "Mubu": "Biao's words are also expressed. "Chun Qiu Zuo Zhuan" said that the roadside tree is the road table, saying that looking at its mark to know its way." "Selected Works. Sun Xinggong's "You Tiantai Mountain Fu": "The Chicheng rises up and builds the mark, and the waterfall flows to the boundary." Li Shan's note: "Building a mark, the standing thing thinks it represents the recognition."

" Mark " means writing and marking. Such as "Selected Works. Sun Xinggong's "Preface to the Fu on Tiantai Mountain": "The story is unique in the regular chapter, and the name is marked in the Qiji." Li Shan quoted "Guangya": "The standard is the book." "Qu Bi": "History is not straight, there are books in the generations, and the things have been revealed, then nothing is taken today; there are things that have not been observed by the past, what the comers do not know, today is a little bit different ."

" Bill " means to establish and establish. Such as "Selected Works. Yuan Yanbo "Preface to the Famous Officials of the Three Kingdoms": "Sorrowful preparations, victory over Tu Weilong. Mr. Mark it, lift the breeze." Zhang Xian's note: "Bao, Li Ye." Southern Song Liu Yiqing "Shi Shuo New Language." "Literature": "Zhi Zhuoran puts the new reason on the table of the two schools, and makes different meanings outside of the sages, and all the famous and sages can't find their taste." Later generations used "to be different" to propose new insights, which is different.

" Standard " means standards and guidelines. Such as the Eastern Han Dynasty Gao lure "Lu Shi Chunqiu. "Preface": "However, in this book, morality is the standard, and inaction is the key to discipline." Du Fu of the Tang Dynasty "Gift to Zheng Eighteen Ben": "Show me a hundred essays, a standard for poets."

" Biao " means role model and representative. Such as Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long. Song Zan: "Chen Si's decorations are marked with "Prince"; Lu Jiji's article, but "Professionals" is the most prominent; its commendation and criticism are mixed, and it also consolidates the wrong body of the last generation." "Book of Jin. "The Legend of Wang Zhen": "The momentary mark of the dead uncle, the hero of thousands of years."
humanum_short_description_en: From " wood ", " ticket " sound. The original meaning is the top of the tree, which means the branch or surface of a thing by extension, and also refers to marks, guidelines, etc.
humanum_full_description:
從「木」，「票」聲。本義是樹梢。《說文》：「標，木杪末也。从木，票聲。」《莊子．天地》：「上如標枝，民如野鹿。」陸德明釋文：「言樹杪之枝無心在上也。」《後漢書．馬融列傳上》「杪標端」，李賢注：「杪、標，並木末也。」

　　「標」引申表示頂端。《玉篇．本部》：「標，顛也。」如《楚辭．九章．悲回風》：「上高巖之峭岸兮，處雌蜺之標顛。」唐代李白〈蜀道難〉：「上有六龍回日之高標，下有沖波逆折之回川。」「高標」即高山的尖端。

　　「標」又表示事物的枝節或表面，與「本」相對。如《淮南子．天文》：「物類相動，本標相應。」《素問．標本病傳論》：「病發而有餘，本而標之，先治其本，後治其標。」後以「治標不治本」形容僅處理問題的枝節，而沒有解決問題的根本。

　　「標」也表示標志、標記。徐鍇《說文繫傳．木部》：「標之言表也。《春秋左傳》謂路旁樹為道表，謂遠望其標以知其道也。」《文選．孫興公〈游天臺山賦〉》：「赤城霞起而建標，瀑布飛流以界道。」李善注：「建標，立物以為之表識也。」

　　「標」表示書寫、標明。如《文選．孫興公〈游天台山賦序〉》：「故事絕於常篇，名標於奇紀。」李善注引《廣雅》：「標，書也。」唐代劉知幾《史通．曲筆》：「史之不直，代有其書，苟其事已彰，則今無所取；其有往賢之所未察，來者之所不知，今略廣異聞，用標先覺。」

　　「標」表示樹立、建立。如《文選．袁彥伯〈三國名臣序贊〉》：「喪亂備矣，勝塗未隆。先生標之，振起清風。」張銑注：「標，立也。」南朝宋劉義慶《世說新語．文學》：「支卓然標新理於二家之表，立異義於眾賢之外，皆是諸名賢尋味之所不得。」後世以「標新立異」指提出新的見解，與眾不同。

　　「標」表示標準、準則。如東漢高誘《呂氏春秋．序》：「然此書所尚，以道德為標的，以無為為綱紀。」唐代杜甫〈贈鄭十八賁〉：「示我百篇文，詩家一標準。」

　　「標」表示榜樣、代表。如南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍．頌贊》：「陳思所綴，以〈皇子〉為標；陸機積篇，惟〈功臣〉最顯；其褒貶雜居，固末代之訛體也。」《晉書．王楨之傳》：「亡叔一時之標，公千載之英。」
humanum_short_description: 從「木」，「票」聲。本義是樹梢，引申表示事物的枝節或表面，又指標記、準則等。

biao1
HSK 4: 標,标
標標RS
标标 		a mark, symbol, label, sign, standard
  • mark a ballot 票 before it goes in the wooden 木 box while counting the votes/wooden 木 object on the altar 示: a symbol of religion
(Simplified: 标)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 本
Pictophonetic: 票 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 票 [ piào ] bank note; ticket; vote; a slip of paper
①樹木的末端，引申爲表面的，非根本的：標本。治標不治本。
②記號：商標。路標。標記。標誌。標尺。標語。
③用文字或其他事物表明：標明。標題。標價。標榜(原爲揭示、表明；後引申爲宣揚、吹噓)。
④給競賽優勝者的獎品，亦指優勝：錦標。奪標。
⑤對一項工程或一批貨物，依照一定的標準，提出價目，然後由競爭廠商選擇，決定成交與否：投標。招標。
⑥準的，榜樣：目標。標領(傑出人物)。
⑦風度，格調：標格。
⑧中國清末陸軍編制的名稱，約相當於後來的一個團；亦用作計量軍隊的單位：一標人馬。標下(ａ．總督、巡撫、提督等稱歸自己管轄的軍隊；b．下級武官對長官的自稱)。
標準 [ biāo zhǔn ]: (an official) standard; norm; criterion; Classifiers: 个
標題 [ biāo tí ]: title; heading; headline; caption; subject
標誌 [ biāo zhì ]: sign; mark; symbol; logo; to symbolize; to indicate; to mark
(Simplified: 标)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 本
Pictophonetic: 票 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 4
Kanshudo mnemonic:you put the ballot paper (票) on the tree (木) as a sign

Chinese: Trees were frequenly used as markers in those days, indicating where one had to go to cast their ballots/tickets.
koohii1: Trees were frequenly used as signposts in those days, indicating where one had to go to cast their ballots.
koohii2: Large wooden signposts are planted on peoples lawns, with the faces of their representatives all saying: "Vote [1] Me!" for the upcoming ballot.
Meaning: mark

Kind: traditional

從「 木 」，「 票 」聲。本義是樹梢。《說文》：「標，木杪末也。从木，票聲。」《莊子．天地》：「上如標枝，民如野鹿。」陸德明釋文：「言樹杪之枝無心在上也。」《後漢書．馬融列傳上》「杪標端」，李賢注：「杪、標，並木末也。」 「 標 」引申表示頂端。《玉篇．本部》：「標，顛也。」如《楚辭．九章．悲回風》：「上高巖之峭岸兮，處雌蜺之標顛。」唐代李白〈蜀道難〉：「上有六龍回日之高標，下有沖波逆折之回川。」「高標」即高山的尖端。 「 標 」又表示事物的枝節或表面，與「 本 」相對。如《淮南子．天文》：「物類相動，本標相應。」《素問．標本病傳論》：「病發而有餘，本而標之，先治其本，後治其標。」後以「治標不治本」形容僅處理問題的枝節，而沒有解決問題的根本。 「 標 」也表示標志、標記。徐鍇《說文繫傳．木部》：「標之言表也。《春秋左傳》謂路旁樹為道表，謂遠望其標以知其道也。」《文選．孫興公〈游天臺山賦〉》：「赤城霞起而建標，瀑布飛流以界道。」李善注：「建標，立物以為之表識也。」 「 標 」表示書寫、標明。如《文選．孫興公〈游天台山賦序〉》：「故事絕於常篇，名標於奇紀。」李善注引《廣雅》：「標，書也。」唐代劉知幾《史通．曲筆》：「史之不直，代有其書，苟其事已彰，則今無所取；其有往賢之所未察，來者之所不知，今略廣異聞，用標先覺。」 「 標 」表示樹立、建立。如《文選．袁彥伯〈三國名臣序贊〉》：「喪亂備矣，勝塗未隆。先生標之，振起清風。」張銑注：「標，立也。」南朝宋劉義慶《世說新語．文學》：「支卓然標新理於二家之表，立異義於眾賢之外，皆是諸名賢尋味之所不得。」後世以「標新立異」指提出新的見解，與眾不同。 「 標 」表示標準、準則。如東漢高誘《呂氏春秋．序》：「然此書所尚，以道德為標的，以無為為綱紀。」唐代杜甫〈贈鄭十八賁〉：「示我百篇文，詩家一標準。」 「 標 」表示榜樣、代表。如南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍．頌贊》：「陳思所綴，以〈皇子〉為標；陸機積篇，惟〈功臣〉最顯；其褒貶雜居，固末代之訛體也。」《晉書．王楨之傳》：「亡叔一時之標，公千載之英。」

"Heaven and Earth": "Upward is like a standard branch, and people are like a wild deer." Lu Deming explained: "The branch of the tree at the end of the word is not on the upper side." 標字的基本解释

標
biāo
见“标”。

標字的汉语字典释义

[①]［biāo］
［《廣韻》甫遥切，平宵，幫。］
［《廣韻》方小切，上小，非。］
亦作“墂1”。“标1”的繁体字。“剽3”的被通假字。
(1)树梢。
(2)末梢；事物的枝节或表面。与“本”相对。
(3)顶端。
(4)特指山峰、山顶。
(5)始。与“終”相对。
(6)柱子之类。
(7)标志，符号。
(8)特指旧时出卖妇女、儿童或物品所插的草芥或竹篾标志。
(9)旗帜。
(10)题写。
(11)标明，显出。
(12)显扬。
(13)树立；建立。
(14)悬挂。
(15)准的；准则。
(16)榜样；代表。
(17)格调，风度。
(18)标致，俊美。
(19)威风；脾气；火气。
(20)古代指北斗七星的第五至第七星。
(21)古代武器名。参见“標子”、“標槍”。
(22)清督抚等所辖绿营兵编制名称。相当于后来的团。
(23)今上海市松江、浙江省、杭鄞等地所产的一种棉布。
(24)给竞赛优胜者的奖品。
(25)犹盯，注视。

標字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　標； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页550第12
【唐韻】甫遙切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?遙切，?音猋。木末也。【管子·霸言篇】大本而小標。【淮南子·天文訓】本標相應。　又高枝曰標。【莊子·天地篇】上如標枝，民如野鹿。　又表也。【禮·投壺】疏：飮畢之後，司射請爲勝者樹標。【晉書·宣帝紀】立兩標以別新舊。　又旌旗也。【淸異錄】梁祖建火龍標。　又標樹，位置也。【唐書·王義方傳】高自標樹。　又書也。【孫綽·天台山賦】名標於奇紀。　又【說文】敷沼切，音縹。【廣韻】方小切，音?。義?同。　【說文】作?。

考證：〔【禮·投壺】飮畢之後，司射請爲勝者樹標。〕　謹按此孔疏非經文。謹照原書投壺下增疏字。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［biāo］
["Guang Yun" cuts far away, Ping Xiao, help. ]
["Guangyun" Fang Xiaoqie, Shangxiao, Fei. ]
Also known as "墂1". Traditional characters of "标1". The false word for "剽3".
(1) Treetops.
(2) The tip; the branch or surface of a thing. Contrast with "this".
(3) The top.
(4) Especially refers to mountain peaks and mountain tops.
(5) Beginning. Contrast with "end".
(6) Pillars and the like.
(7) Signs and symbols.
(8) Specifically refers to the grass mustard or bamboo strips used to sell women, children, or objects.
(9) Flags.
(10) Inscription.
(11) Mark and show.
(12) Xianyang.
(13) Establish; establish.
(14) Hanging.
(15) Standard; Standard.
(16) Role model; representative.
(17) Style and grace.
(18) Peugeot, handsome.
(19) Prestige; temper; anger.
(20) In ancient times, it refers to the fifth to seventh stars of the Big Dipper.
(21) Ancient weapon names. See "Biaozi", "Javelin".
(22) The name of the green camp troops under the jurisdiction of the Qing governor. Equivalent to the later regiment.
(23) A cotton cloth produced in Songjiang, Zhejiang, Hangyin and other places in Shanghai today.
(24) Prizes to contest winners.
(25) Still staring, watching.

Name meaning
Nothing.
biāo
вм. 标
Radicals: 木, 覀, 示  (tree, helicopter, jackhammer)
Meaning Mnemonic
You see a tree with a helicopter and a jackhammer tied to it. You look closer, because this is an odd sight, and realize that there is a sign here too. It's telling you to beware of helicopters and jackhammers in this woods. It's a poorly made signpost!
This is not the best signpost you've ever seen, but it's better than nothing at all, you suppose.
Reading Mnemonic
As you look at this weird signpost you notice a button. You press it because it will supposedly tell you more about these dangerous helicopters and jackhammers. Instead, it just yells out in a loud obnoxious voice: HEYO (ひょう)!!
Press it a few more times and hear the sound in your head. Also spell it out in kana as you hear it as a nice little additional visual.
